explanation: Agent A’s scenario describes a possible runtime indirect recursion only if the application’s acceptance-policy callback (daemon->apc) calls back into MHD_add_connection. The library code itself does not contain a direct or guaranteed indirect call chain that leads back to MHD_add_connection: the chain stops at the application-supplied function pointer. MISRA Rule 17.2 prohibits functions calling themselves (directly or indirectly) in the program’s call graph; whether a violation exists depends on the whole program, not just the library. The library’s call of a user callback makes an indirect recursion possible but does not itself constitute a definite recursive call within the library code. Therefore the report as a library-only violation is not correct. If full-program analysis (including the application callback) shows the application callback indeed calls MHD_add_connection, then the combined program would violate Rule 17.2 — but that is an application integration issue, not an intrinsic violation in the shown MHD_add_connection implementation.
